passage_text: Practice managers. The average pay per hour for a practice manager working in a dental practice in the UK was &163;9.49 (base = 139). Practice managers with 11 or more years of experience earned an average hourly rate of &163;9.91 (compared with &163;8.88 for those with less than 5 years of experience).
A Dental Nurse earns an average wage of AU$22.24 per hour. Most people with this job move on to other positions after 20 years in this career.

Dental nurses. The average pay per hour for a trained dental nurse in the UK was &163;6.57 (base = 661). The highest rates of pay were in Greater London (&163;7.49 per hour) and Southern England (&163;7.03 per hour). The average pay per hour increased with number of years of experience.

The average pay per hour for a trained dental nurse in the UK was &163;6.57 (base = 661). The highest rates of pay were in Greater London (&163;7.49 per hour) and Southern England (&163;7.03 per hour).

X Total Pay combines base annual salary or hourly wage, bonuses, profit sharing, tips, commissions, overtime pay and other forms of cash earnings, as applicable for this job. It does not include equity (stock) compensation, cash value of retirement benefits, or the value of other non-cash benefits (e.g. healthcare).

X Total Pay combines base annual salary or hourly wage, bonuses, profit sharing, tips, commissions, overtime pay and other forms of cash earnings, as applicable for this job. It does not include equity (stock) compensation, cash value of retirement benefits, or the value of other non-cash benefits (e.g. healthcare).

Trainee dental nurses. The average pay per hour for a trainee dental nurse in the UK was found to be &163;5.01 (base = 217). The average pay for trainee dental nurses in the South East of England (including London) was 22% higher than in the rest of the UK.
A Dental Nurse earns an average wage of £8.17 per hour. The highest paying skills associated with this job are Oral Health Education, Health Education, and Sedation.

Data from the latest Annual Survey of Hours and Salaries publication from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) puts the average dental nurse salary at £15,024 in 2013. The figure in 2012 was £17,949, so there has been a fairly significant drop.
